Tamil Nadu Rains: Schools, colleges to remain closed tomorrow in these districts
The government has declared a holiday for all educational institutions on Friday in view of heavy rainfall. Let's find out whether Tamil Nadu schools will remain closed on December 14.
Chennai: Incessant rains continue to affect several coastal districts in Tamil Nadu along with Puducherry today, December 13. The latest reports suggest that the overflow of the Thamirabarani River has affected residents of low-lying areas. The Tamil Nadu government is closely monitoring the situation of heavy rainfall in various parts.
According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the rains will continue until December 16. In this situation, parents and students from rain-affected districts keep waiting for the official announcement regarding the school closure. Letâ€™s find out whether Tamil Nadu schools closed or not on Saturday, i.e., December 14.
Tamil Nadu schools closed latest news
The government has decided to close all educational institutions as a precautionary measure as the impact of rains continues in several districts of the state. Schools and colleges have been closed in several districts of Tamil Nadu. Madurai District Collector MC Sangeetha has decided to close all schools in the district on Friday due to heavy rains. Schools and colleges in Mayiladuthurai, Thanjavur, Pudukottai, Karur and Trichy districts were closed on Friday due to heavy rains. As the rains are still affecting these districts, there is little chance of reopening on Saturday.
As of now, there is no official information from the district collectors regarding school closure or reopening. Parents and students are advised to stay in touch with the school authorities and follow the official social media handles regarding whether the schools will be closed or not.
Will Chennai schools close on December 14?
The flood alert was issued to a few areas in Chennai as the Poondi Reservoir and Chembarambakkam Reservoir reached its maximum capacity. The rains have caused waterlogging in several parts of the capital city. There is no clarity on whether schools and colleges in Chennai are closed or not in the city.
Puducherry schools closed news
Puducherry Education Minister Namachivayam has declared a holiday for schools and colleges in Puducherry and Karaikal on Friday. The sources suggest that the school closure order may be extended to Saturday. However, there is no official announcement yet from the district authorities.
